messages.subject: Re: Disadvantages of an Umbrella (private) School??
messages.msgSnippet: ... I think more options to public school are better than less!  So, in general, I think umbrella schools are a wonderful thing. Ideally, there should be no
messages.messageBody:
>Are there
> any disadvantages to using an umbrella school?
>

I think more options to public school are better than less! So, in
general, I think umbrella schools are a wonderful thing.

Ideally, there should be no need of such a thing because, in my own
little ideal world scenario, there would be no laws regulating
homeschooling, therefore, no need to jump through the hoops of an
umbrella school to avoid intrusive testing and oversite.

So, all in all, the disadvantage that I see of using an umbrella school,
is perpetuating the need of it.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Disadvantages of an Umbrella (private) School??
messages.msgSnippet: -=-Are there any disadvantages to using an umbrella school?-=- Let s discuss this idea as it applies to anyone in the world, rather than to Florida
messages.messageBody:
-=-Are there
any disadvantages to using an umbrella school?-=-

Let's discuss this idea as it applies to anyone in the world, rather
than to Florida specifically.



For particulars about Florida, please go to http://sandradodd.com/
world and check with people on those Florida lists.



Sandra

messages.subject: Disadvantages of an Umbrella (private) School??
messages.msgSnippet: My oldest just turned 6 and we need to meet the FL requirment of either sending a letter of intent to homeschool or enrolling him in a private school.  I was
messages.messageBody:
My oldest just turned 6 and we need to meet the FL requirment of either
sending a letter of intent to homeschool or enrolling him in
a "private" school. I was leaning toward the umbrella school b/c it
only requires "attendance" records and we could avoid the
testing/evaluations necessary under the homeschool choice. Are there
any disadvantages to using an umbrella school?

Thanks!
Kim
